M. Gustave.Action: Runs a once-celebrated but now shabby hotel gracefully despite its decline.
Maintains a dignified atmosphere and manages guests even as the hotel is mostly abandoned and deteriorating.
Allows the hotel to fall into disrepair without apparent efforts to improve or renovate during off-season.
Swiftly manages multiple staff members, gives clear, confident instructions, and checks details thoroughly (tickets, hats, timing).
Maintains composure and control in a hectic environment while attending personally to an important guest's needs.
Remains calm and attentive when Madame D. expresses fear, patiently tries to understand her concerns and provides emotional support.
Despite his frustration with the situation, he takes charge by asking Madame D. to explain specifically what troubles her.
Hesitates and displays reluctance when asked to pray and take on a role outside his expertise, but ultimately complies respectfully.
Displays puzzlement and disbelief instead of immediately grasping the seriousness of Madame D.'s feelings and situation.
Prays sincerely for Madame D.'s safe travel, showing care and concern.
Firmly clasps Madame D.'s hand and speaks reassuringly to ease her anxiety.
Criticizes Madame D.'s fingernail polish harshly, expressing physical repulsion in a somewhat patronizing way.
Encourages Madame D. to listen to soothing words to calm her anxiety.
Offers a comforting and reassuring handclasp to Madame D., speaks in an affectionate and calming tone to ease her anxiety.
Notices and criticizes Madame D.'s nail polish color as 'physically repulsed,' causing her to stiffen and show uncertainty.
Monitors time carefully and decisively prompts action ('Time to go!'), showing punctuality and control over the situation.
Tightens a fur stole around Madame D's shoulders to comfort her.
Promises to see to Madame D's request himself and reassures her sincerely.
Responds sincerely to Madame D's expression of love and acknowledges her feelings gently.
Speaks with discreet pride about winning the loyalty of Madame D.
Recites poetry to calm Madame D., showing sensitive social skill and cultured behavior.
Instructs the driver firmly to depart on time, displaying command and control.
Accepts the coin and promises to take immediate action to fulfill Madame D.'s request, showing reliability and responsibility.
Reflects on his long-standing loyalty with pride and confidence, indicating self-awareness of his social/relationship competence.
Orders Zero to buy a candle and a pastry, instructs him to give leftover money to a crippled shoe-shine boy.
Looks squarely at Zero for the first time and questions his identity and hiring.
Gives detailed, precise instructions involving coordination and charity, showing clear organization and presence of mind.
Stops Zero before he runs off to ensure clarity and control, demonstrating awareness and leadership.
Questions the legitimacy of Zero's hiring promptly and directly, indicating diligence and assertiveness.
Warmly responds to hotel guest with 'The pleasure is mine, Herr Schneider.'
Curtly orders Anatole to straighten his cap.
Critiques the bouquet of white roses as 'not acceptable' in front of doorman.
Conducts a strict and somewhat insensitive interview with Zero, noting zero experience and education bluntly.
Conducts a structured and purposeful interview with Zero, making notes on his experience and education.
Corrects Anatole's appearance sharply but appropriately.
Rejects unsuitable flowers with clear judgment, showing attention to detail.
Appears momentarily unsure about what Zero means by lighting a candle.
Speaks sweetly to the dachshund Cicero and flirtatiously to Frau Liebling.
Speaks coldly to the washroom attendant and sharply to the head waiter, showing impatience.
Engages Zero with genuine interest, encourages honesty and praises him when impressed.
Counts the money calmly in front of Zero and displays a letter with a lipstick kiss without comment.
Tucks a lipstick-kissed note and money into his jacket with a moment of reverie.
Responds bristling but playfully when asked if he was ever a Lobby Boy.
Commands Zero sharply to 'go light the goddamn candle.'
Acts as a mentor and guardian to Zero, described as pupil and counselor.
Explains the role of a Lobby Boy emphasizing discretion, anticipation and invisibility.
Advises Zero to keep silent about guests' secrets, demonstrating trust and confidentiality.
Keeps company with numerous elderly female guests, fulfilling his duties and pleasures with them.
Furtively looks up and down the corridor before entering the suite alone and locking the door.
Checks elevator railings for dust while waiting, showing attention to detail and order.
Withdraws a ring of pass-keys and looks furtively up and down the corridor before entering a locked suite.
Directs Zero with a brief, efficient order and anticipates his hesitation.
Maintains discretion and security by locking himself in the suite.
Engages skillfully and confidently with various demanding and discerning clients, maintaining appearances and meeting their expectations.
Checks the elevator railings for dust despite having lipstick on his cheek, showing attention to detail even in personal chaos.
Delivers a nightly sermon promoting tolerance and understanding, emphasizing that rudeness stems from fear and that everyone needs love to open up.
Delivers a nightly sermon to hotel staff emphasizing kindness and emotional understanding, commanding respect and attention.
Maintains a strong and distinct personal presence, marked by his liberally applied perfume, which affects others' perception.
Takes his own dinner alone, quietly listens to classical music, surrounded by many identical cologne bottles.
Seated alone eating cereal while listening to classical music, surrounded by many bottles of cologne labelled with his name, indicating attention to personal grooming and routine.
Meets with Deputy Kovacs, the emissary of the hotel owner, in private consultations with business manager Herr Becker, showing involvement in important hotel management and operations.
Reads news of Countess's death with gravity and sadness, expresses self-blame and emotional pain with tears.
Immediately plans to go to the Countess and requests help from Zero, shows sense of responsibility and close relationship.
Orders a better wine to share with Zero so they don't have to drink poor quality wine, indicating consideration and camaraderie.
Reads the newspaper carefully, immediately decides to visit the Dowager Countess, and organizes packing and logistics swiftly and confidently.
Shows emotional vulnerability and self-blame after the news, indicating reflection but also potential distraction.
Makes a darkly humorous, cynical philosophical remark about life and death while maintaining composure and poise.
Casually compliments a deceased woman on her sexual vitality with a hint of irreverence.
Engages politely and cooperatively with armed soldiers by presenting his documents without resistance.
Philosophizes about life with dark humor, maintains composure in tense environment.
Politely and confidently interacts with armed soldiers, promptly presents passport when requested.
Uses polite, friendly language addressing the soldier (e.g., 'Franz, darling') and smiles to ease tension.
Defends Zero firmly against wrongful arrest, insisting his papers are in order and challenging the soldiers.
Displays some sternness and sharp gestures to maintain order.
Physically struggles and shouts against mistreatment of Zero, showing care and protectiveness.
Defends Zero passionately against soldiers' mistreatment, calling out their behavior in rage.
Calmly explains the relationship with Zero to authority to secure their release, even while injured.
Calmly interrupts the soldiers to explain the situation despite being injured and handcuffed.
Uses his knowledge of Henckels' identity and personal connection to defuse a tense and dangerous situation.
Expresses rage and insults the soldiers loudly after being handcuffed.
Asks Henckels about his mother and sends his love to her.
Recognizes and appreciates the kindness shown to Henckels by Zero.
Reflects on the remaining glimmers of civilization and their modest role in it, showing a sincere but somewhat weary attitude.
Maintains composure during tense interaction with Henckels and soldiers; uses polite conversation to ease tension.
Makes a reflective but disheartened comment about civilization, showing emotional burden.
Kisses Madame D.'s corpse affectionately on both cheeks and lips, speaks kindly to her, compliments her appearance even after death
Observes and appreciates intimate details about Madame D. (notices lacquered fingernails), showing attentiveness and respect for her choices
Commands Clotilde somewhat curtly ('A glass of chilled water with no ice, please.' and slightly irritated reaction to notification)
Initiates immediate action to locate Madame D., confidently leads through the mansion.
Calmly sits beside the corpse and speaks to it in a composed, controlled manner.
Notices altered detail on the corpse (lacquered nails), indicating attention to detail.
Leads with polite commands, e.g., requesting water with no ice, maintaining decorum.
Kisses the corpse on the lips, an unconventional act that causes discreet disgust in observers.
Responds to anxiety in his staff by immediately investigating the cause, showing concern and urgency.
Ignores Clotilde's reluctant advice and pushes forward into the unknown to address the situation.
Checks watch, calmly observes surroundings despite chaotic kitchen environment.
Frowns and questions the situation out loud (What the devil is going on?).
Dumps water into a cactus, signaling dismissal of small distractions and decisiveness.
Marches ahead determinedly despite Clotilde's reluctant advice to stop.
Enters the trophy room hesitantly, observes the situation quietly with Zero, showing situational awareness but some hesitation.
Expresses surprise and gratitude upon learning about the bequest, showing sincere emotional reaction ('Wow! I can't believe it.')
Grips Zero by the shoulder firmly, indicating a protective/supportive gesture though it causes discomfort ('like a vise'), reflecting caring yet intense behavior
Responds to the old man's question about his identity with a charming, friendly tone ('I'm afraid that's me, darling.')
Receives the unexpected bequest of a valuable painting and remains composed and confident in the tense and confrontational atmosphere.
Expresses genuine surprise and disbelief with exclamations like 'Wow!' and 'I can't believe it,' displaying emotional reaction but maintaining control.
Grips Zero firmly by the shoulder, showing a protective and assertive stance amid conflict.
Calmly identifies himself publicly when questioned, accepting the situation without panic.
States he has come to pay respects to a great woman he loved.
Responds genuinely offended to Dmitri's homophobic insult.
Shrugs and says he goes to bed with all his friends when accused of immoral behavior.
Clearly asserts legal knowledge regarding the estate, confidently challenges Dmitri's claim about ownership and the painting.
Responds calmly and with dry wit to personal insults during a tense confrontation, maintaining composure.
Shrugs off a severe physical attack without immediate retaliation, showing restraint and situational awareness.
Makes a tactless joke about his sexual relationships during a serious dispute, potentially alienating witnesses.
Turns away from a violent confrontation despite insults and threats, choosing to leave instead of escalating conflict.
Accepts Zero's curiosity and allows him to see the priceless painting, despite initially seeming surprised.
Appreciates and shares poetic admiration of a painting with Zero, displaying openness and warmth in sharing beauty.
Uses a sarcastic and potentially offensive joke ('I thought I was supposed to be a fucking faggot') in a tense situation.
Maintains composure and wit despite being dizzy and physically restrained, manages to leave the conflict calmly with assistance.
Avoids escalating confrontation by changing the subject when confronted aggressively.
Allows Zero to see the priceless painting despite potential risk.
Leads Zero through the library and shares detailed appreciation of art, including complimenting Zero's glass of milk as 'impeccable provenance' and calling the painting a masterpiece.
Allows Zero to replace an important painting with a provocative wood-cut print, hesitating but ultimately not forbidding it.
Shows curiosity and attentiveness to Zero's odd behavior with the installation of the wood-cut print.
Leads Zero through the library, confidently explaining the significance of the 'Boy with Apple' painting and its value.
Hesitates and looks uncertain after removing the painting from the wall, unsure about what to do next.
Instructs Serge to carefully wrap the valuable painting and ensures its safekeeping during transportation.
Sharply directs the taxi driver to the station, indicating clear decisiveness and control over the situation.
Reflects on the importance of the painting and plans proactively to sell it soon to prevent theft.
Pauses and shows emotional attachment to the painting, which could hint at personal bias affecting judgment.
Proposes a solemn blood-pact to Zero, offering loyalty, a share of sale price, and eventual inheritance.
Pledges to reward Zero fairly and shares personal belongings and poetry as inheritance.
Jokes lightly with Zero, showing humor in their negotiation.
Mumbles anxiously when surprised by Anatole, yet maintains composure and cheerfully tells him to inform the police.
Greets the police officers politely and professionally despite being under arrest.
Instructs Zero to keep silent about sensitive information to protect them both.
Hides a suspicious package in the vault, possibly indicating secretiveness or distrust.
Hides the wrapped package carefully behind a radiator and secures the vault with multiple locks.
Responds cheerily and confidently to Anatole informing him the police are here, maintaining composure.
Advises Zero to keep silent under questioning, showing presence of mind in a tense situation.
Faces the police calmly and greets them politely despite being arrested, showing control and confidence.
Comments 'I knew there was something fishy!' possibly as a defensive reaction in the face of arrest for murder, which might indicate some overconfidence or naivety.
Sits calmly and speaks candidly to Zero despite his battered appearance in prison.
Uses harsh language to describe his violent act to prove himself in prison.
Breaks into a sprint through the lobby to evade the police.
Maintains composure and uses prison etiquette to assert dominance by physically beating an inmate to earn respect on Day One.
Physically defeats a stronger opponent quickly and confidently to establish respect.
Maintains calm and composure despite being under suspicion and accusation.
Irritatedly postpones discussing a matter that could be important, potentially ignoring immediate concerns.
Reconsiders his harsh judgment of Serge and expresses disbelief that Serge would betray him, suggesting he has been betrayed by others instead.
Refuses to implicate a married woman to protect her name from scandal despite it possibly aiding his defense.
Shows vulnerability by sighing, staring at the floor, and appearing about to cry.
Calls Serge 'that little prick' and 'bitch', initially showing bitterness and harshness.
Expresses doubt about accusations, shows awareness of deceit and the dangers he is facing.
Nonchalantly refuses to involve an alibi who is married to a powerful duke, prioritizing discretion over immediate self-defense.
Appears shaken and almost about to cry, showing vulnerability and possible emotional overwhelm.
Writes a letter to staff expressing deep care and longing, urging them to maintain the hotel's impeccable reputation as if under his vigilant watch.
Threatens staff with 'swift and merciless justice' for any lapse during his absence.
Writes a formal, motivating letter to his staff from prison, instructing them to maintain the hotel's impeccable reputation with vigilance and care.
Brandishes a soup-ladle as a symbolic weapon to emphasize his warnings from prison, demonstrating confidence and control despite incarceration.

Successfully persuades a large and intimidating convict with a scar to try the offered food by using calm, polite, and personalized engagement, demonstrating situational awareness and interpersonal skill.
Offers food to convicts who ignore him or respond with blank looks, shows awareness of social cues and does not press unnecessarily, displaying restraint and professionalism.
Encourages sleeping convicts to wake up with a cheerful tone, effectively rousing Pinky and others, showing leadership and motivational skill.
Shares a pastry with convicts and praises the quality of Mendl's pastries
Expresses sincere gratitude when accepted by convicts as 'one of us'
Listens and obeys Pinky's request to sit back down without complaint
Produces a pink pastry-box and shares pastries with convicts, gaining their trust and camaraderie.
Obeys Pinky’s signal to sit back down, showing social awareness and adaptability in a tense situation.
Engages politely and with gratitude when accepted by convicts, demonstrating emotional intelligence and confidence.
Compliments Ludwig’s artistic skill and gives sincere praise.
Examines the detailed map of the prison escape plan with fixed concentration and evaluates its quality, praising Ludwig's drawing and artistic promise.
Analyzes the problem with calm and focus, acknowledges harsh conditions expected for the task
Nods gravely, encouraging the group though they slump listless and sigh
Recommends a book of Romantic Poetry to Zero as a gift for Agatha, encouraging a romantic gesture.
Sits opposite Agatha, holds her hand, makes her laugh uproariously.
Presents Agatha with a porcelain pendant and five dozen white tulips.
Offers comforting, conciliatory advice to Zero about jealousy.
Flirts openly with Agatha despite her relationship with Zero.
Insists on an immediate and thorough cross-examination, presenting thoughtful gifts (porcelain pendant and tulips) to Agatha to endear her and demonstrate seriousness.
Leans close, vividly recounting stories and making Agatha laugh uproariously, showing skill in interpersonal charm and confidence.
Offers philosophical advice to Zero about jealousy and supports the relationship diplomatically, demonstrating emotional intelligence and social skill.
Shrugs off potential jealousy teasing and maintains composure while approving the union, showing self-confidence and control.
Works diligently with Pinky, Günther, and Ludwig to chip away the cement in prison cell, showing cooperation and focus.
Implied as part of a plan to protect a valuable painting and safeguard others involved, showing concern for others' survival and well-being.
Is mentioned as a figure whose survival a plan must be made for, indicating importance and reliance by others.
No direct actions or statements in this excerpt; however, the context implies involvement in careful planning and secrecy around a stolen valuable painting.
Expresses sincere gratitude to the giant for intervening to protect the escape group.
Leads and participates in a risky, skillful escape down a tower using a rope ladder, showing calmness and decisiveness under pressure.
Recognizes and thanks the giant with a scar who intervenes to suppress an alarm, demonstrating awareness and social intelligence.
Carefully and stealthily participates in a risky escape plan with comrades, showing cooperation and shared trust.
Cheers and whispers advice and encouragement to friends during a violent struggle.
Quietly acknowledges the violent fight outcome with a dry, ironic comment.
Solemnly concurs with a respectful eulogy for the fallen fighters.
Politely greets Zero after emerging from the storm-drain.
Introduces his companions to Zero, fostering social connection.
Calmly observes the fight, offers quiet encouragement and advice, and maintains composure throughout the violent chaos.
Uses understatement and dry humor ('I suppose you'd call that a draw') to assess a violent and chaotic situation accurately.
Emerges from the storm drain quietly and confidently, calmly greeting Zero with a simple 'Good evening.'
Crosses himself quickly and makes a wistful speech about uncertain future.
Grabs Zero by the shoulder and urgently asks about the safe house.
Calmly accepts Zero's inability to find a safe house and adjusts the plan accordingly.
Expresses frustration when Zero misunderstands disguise instructions but remains patient and calm.
Bluntly asks for his own share of the scent after Zero forgets it.
Remains calm and resigned after hearing there is no safe house, calmly devises a plan to wing it and use disguises.
Corrects Zero’s misunderstanding about disguises and insists on proper preparation, showing attention to detail and standards.
Becomes frustrated but maintains composure and tries to improvise despite setbacks (lack of disguises and scent), demonstrating adaptability.
Fails to secure proper disguises or ensure essential items like scent (L’air de Panache) are brought, indicating an oversight.
Mocks and insults Zero's background, implying inferiority and making harsh generalizations.
Stops to listen to Zero's painful truth about war, family loss, and refugee status.
Shows genuine shame and self-reproach for his earlier harsh judgment of Zero.
Exhibits self-awareness and humility by admitting his mistake and apologizing after learning about Zero's tragic background.
Initially reacts with frustration and prejudice based on assumptions about Zero's origin.
Expresses deep deference and sincere apology to Zero, acknowledges his feelings, and calls him a dear friend and protégé.
Demonstrates physical affection by kissing Zero on both cheeks and embracing him.
Shows encouragement and interest in Zero by asking about Agatha and praising Zero's recitation.
Takes initiative to seek help using a telephone, explaining situation calmly to Zero and requesting assistance.
Maintains deep deference and sincere emotional connection to Zero despite distress, showing emotional intelligence and leadership.
Effectively manages a tense moment by imposing a pause on Zero's recital and organizing their next move when the alarm sounds.
Quickly adapts to emergency by deciding to contact the Excelsior Palace and take immediate action despite limited options.
Shares secret information cautiously, insisting on sworn secrecy.
Turns on charm when speaking to M. Ivan to request help.
Does not openly share details when asked by Zero, maintaining mystery.
Secretly coordinates a plan with careful discretion, insisting on secrecy and trust from Zero.
Confidently contacts an ally (M. Ivan) via telephone and uses charm and persuasive language to enlist special services quickly.
Demonstrates knowledge of exclusive social access (opera seats, private gallery viewings, prime restaurant tables) to impress and instruct Zero, showing high social intelligence and resourcefulness.
Waits hidden behind a hay-stack next to the telephone booth during a covert operation.
Re-caps situation with Zero, explaining clearly despite Zero's confusion.
Quickly responds to danger, dashes with Zero to the vehicle.
Questions the third class train ticket with puzzled objection, showing concern for comfort or status.
Feels deeply touched by M. Ivan's small gift and wants to reciprocate with a symbolic gesture by giving money.
Firmly insists on giving M. Ivan 25 Klubecks despite Zero's hesitation, showing generosity and gratitude.
Expresses genuine gratitude by saying 'Bless you' and bows respectfully, acknowledging kindness sincerely.
Sprays perfume and improves posture, then offers cologne to Zero, sharing a gesture of care and camaraderie.
Decides to give M. Ivan money as a symbolic gesture despite limited funds, showing social tact and generosity.
Sprays himself with perfume and immediately improves his posture and bearing, demonstrating awareness of self-presentation and confidence.
Attempts to discreetly give money to M. Ivan who refuses it, showing respectful social interaction and emotional intelligence.
Does not push the matter when M. Ivan refuses the money, respecting boundaries and social cues.
Defends Serge by acknowledging his fear instead of blaming harshly.
Shows tolerance by attributing moral failure to fear rather than malice.
Is accused of removing the painting but no direct denial or explanation is given in the excerpt.
Whispers quietly and calmly with Zero on a crowded train, showing composure in a difficult situation.
Reflects thoughtfully about moral failings, showing insight and intellectual capacity.
Avoids direct confrontation or defensive action when accused, potentially indicating self-control or possible evasion.
Expresses deep sincerity and feeling about Agatha's hardworking nature and purity despite her flaws.
Offers to officiate a ceremony humbly and pleasantly when asked.
Scoffs and shows irritation when warned not to flirt with Agatha.
Offers to officiate the ceremony, showing confidence and willingness to take responsibility.
Expresses deep sincerity and insightful appreciation of the girl's qualities, demonstrating perceptiveness and emotional intelligence.
Scoffs and gets irritated when warned not to flirt, indicating a possible lapse in self-control and professionalism.
Shares a quiet moment with Zero, engaging in a small ritual of applying cologne together.
Hesitates briefly when questioned by the monk, showing vulnerability.
Prompts Zero to board the cable-car promptly when urged, cooperating without complaint.
Checks his watch punctually and discusses time precisely with Zero.
Spritzes cologne ritualistically and passes the habit to Zero, maintaining composure under tense conditions.
Hesitates when questioned by the monk but eventually complies and sprints to board the cable-car promptly.
Hesitates before affirming identity to the monk.
Carefully and calmly exchanges cable-cars with monk, showing composure in a potentially dangerous situation.
Shares a look with Zero after the switch, indicating solidarity and teamwork.
Follows directions promptly and cooperates with monks during procession despite apparent suspicion.
Responds irritably and snaps at monk who questions him.
Swiftly slips on cloaks and hymnals to blend into the procession despite being caught off guard.
Initially hesitates and shows irritation when confronted by monks questioning his identity and demanding confession.
Follows monks' instructions to enter the confessional booth after initial hesitation, showing adaptability to unexpected situations.
Consoles Serge gently after he reveals his family tragedy.
Shows frustration and impatience demanding details about the second will.
Calls Serge 'darling' and shows some empathy.
Acknowledges Serge's grief and tries to be tactful before pressing for information.
Maintains focus and persistence despite emotional frustration, presses Serge for crucial information calmly at first, demonstrating control and urgency in a tense situation.
Loses composure and raises voice in frustration at a critical moment, temporarily undermining his usual control and gravitas.
Expresses concern for Serge upon finding him strangled and calls him 'the poor slob'.
Presses door quietly shut after discovering Serge, showing respect and discretion.
Tries to open the locked confessional panel by force and door but initially fails, then hesitates before giving Zero the pass-keys.
Trusts and cooperates with Zero to choose and use the correct key to unlock the confessional.
After discovering Serge strangled, reacts calmly by quietly closing the door to avoid detection.
Quickly notices and pursues the lone monk leaving the church, showing quick situational awareness and initiative.
Chases after Zero on a dangerous sled ride to pursue a criminal despite clear risks to safety.
Admits openly that he does not know what to do in a dangerous situation, showing honesty and vulnerability.
Calls Jopling a 'sick, pathetic creep' and expresses hatred while fearing for his life.
Urgently tells Zero to run and save himself despite his own peril.
Recites a sorrowful farewell as he faces likely death calmly and with dignity.
Attempts to pursue Jopling down the bob-sled run at break-neck speed displaying physical courage and determination.
Crashes spectacularly, resulting in the sled splitting and ending up hanging precariously over a chasm.
Despite the dire physical situation, maintains composure, shows courage, and uses wit in his final moments by reciting a dramatic farewell, demonstrating mental acuity and emotional control.
Fails to escape or avoid the deadly trap set by Jopling and is unable to encourage Zero to act, highlighting a moment of helplessness.
Shouts ecstatically to praise Zero after he defeats Jopling: 'Holy shit! You got him!' and 'Well-done, Zero!'
Expresses clear relief and relies on Zero to save him from frostbite and falling
Gives weary but candid admission of preferring death over returning to prison
Responds positively (face lightening) to Zero's proposal to escape together and reclaim the 'Boy with Apple'
Expresses sincere gratitude and admiration towards Zero, calling him extraordinary.
Observes a moment of silence in memoriam for a fallen servant.
Engages in a friendly and encouraging conversation about the warm and kind people of the Maltese Riviera with Zero.
Responds calmly and appreciatively to Zero's plan, showing good judgment.
Leads a quick getaway by sprinting to the motorcycle and coordinating escape with Zero.
Maintains composure and optimism when describing the Maltese Riviera, indicating confidence and knowledge.
No direct action described in this excerpt; focus is on other characters and military presence.
Expresses deep disgust and sadness over the military takeover of the hotel, showing emotional attachment and care.
Speaks eloquently and mournfully about the hotel's decline, indicating sincere feelings.
Whispers Dmitri’s name with contempt, showing a negative attitude towards Dmitri but also loyalty to the hotel.
Waits tense and cautious in the truck with Zero, observing the situation and remaining alert to the arrival of Dmitri.
Expresses deep disgust and pessimism verbally about the hotel turning into a troop barracks, showing emotional impact but maintaining composure.
Whispers Dmitri’s name contemptuously while crouched low, indicating situational awareness and readiness for a potentially hostile interaction.
Whispers Agatha's name worriedly and watches the situation attentively.
Whispers worriedly upon seeing Agatha and the approaching guests, indicating awareness and concern about unfolding events.
Does not intervene directly as Dmitri pursues Agatha, possibly indicating trust in staff or assessment of situation needing discretion.
Strides into the building confidently carrying multiple pastry boxes and interacts warmly with others.
Asks a Lobby Boy specifically about a pastry-girl's movements with focused, purposeful questioning.
Shows irritation when given information that may be potentially compromising or careless, indicating awareness of operational security.
Uses service elevator to evade Dmitri and carries the package covertly; remains calm and composed under pressure.
Does not reveal the location or contents of the package when confronted by Dmitri.
Yells to identify Dmitri as the true criminal during gunfire chaos, defending his own innocence and clarifying the situation.
Sits calmly and impeccably dressed in handcuffs during court testimony, captivating the jury.
Accompanies Zero and others despite being handcuffed, showing solidarity.
Wears his concierge uniform immaculately and gives enrapturing testimony at court, maintaining confidence and composure under pressure.
Is handcuffed alongside others but remains composed and attentive while the legal situation unfolds.
Is found innocent, as shown by the newspaper headline 'Cleared of All Charges.', reflecting effective self-representation and/or ability to navigate legal challenges.
Sits drinking a cocktail with a beautiful, begemmed, ninety-year-old woman, hand resting on her thigh.
Reads from a Bible, officiating a ceremony holding hands with Agatha and Zero.
Compliments Zero affectionately and praises his skills as a Lobby Boy, acknowledging him warmly.
Impresses Agatha by appreciating her recitation and kisses her hand.
Greets soldiers politely and with calm charm despite tense circumstances.
Smiles slightly, reassures Zero and Agatha with a sincere, private message of good luck despite danger.
Shouts insults at oppressive soldiers and physically struggles to defend Zero after he is attacked.
Pledges to see the soldiers punished and demands to know their commanding officer, showing a protective and honorable stance.
Calmly attempts to use official documents to negotiate with enemy soldiers, explains the legitimacy of papers confidently.
After documents are destroyed and negotiation fails, maintains composure, offers a private silent encouragement to allies.
Responds to provocation by aggressively attacking soldiers, resulting in his own capture and Zero being injured.
Shouts furiously and berates those handling him while in handcuffs.
Gives his word to see offenders dishonorably discharged and punished severely.
Shouts furiously, berates his captors confidently, and threatens severe consequences.
Is captured and handcuffed without apparent resistance or escape attempt.
